entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 6:27AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow In Atigun Pass Tonight... Snow is expected to develop in Atigun Pass late tonight and continue into Thursday morning. Several inches of snow could accumulate above 4000 ft. Snow is possible below 4000 feet, but no accumulation is expected as the snow will melt when it hits the ground. This could make travel difficult over Atigun Pass

entry.title: Flood Watch issued June 21 at 12:43AM MDT until June 23 at 1:00AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: .A very moist air mass is in place across the High Plains with dew point values in the 60s to mid 70s resulting in precipitable water values of 1.25 to 1.75 inches.
